text.__SUMMARY__:
Koepcke's hairy-nosed bat (Mimon koepckeae) is a species of bat endemic to Peru.
This species isn’t that well known. It’s located in the Ayacucho department in Peru. This species is highly morphologically similar to the Mimon Crenulatum specie which are also hairy-nosed bats. Some description of these bats are that they have cleft between their first and second upper molars. They have a nose shaped like a leaf with a few hairs on it. There body does however lack stripes
